description: Take the sequence bb with two integer "seeds", e.g. a(1)=0, a(2)=1 and the relating list cc consisting of all digits of bb, e.g. cc={0,1}. Take n=3, calculate d=abs[cc(n-1)-cc(n-2)] = abs(2-3)=1; then next term of bb, a(n), is the smallest "new" (not in bb) number containing digit d, e.g. a(3)=10 => bb={0,1,10} and cc={0,1,1,0}; we proceed: n=4, d = 0, a(4)=20, bb={0,1,10,20}, cc={0,1,1,0,2,0}, n=5, d = 1, a(5)=11, bb={0,1,10,20,11}, cc={0,1,1,0,2,0,1,1}, etc.
